basics.name: Hélène Jonin
basics.label: Software Engineer in transition
basics.summary: I am an experienced Software Engineer, looking for a new career in librarianship and/or archiving, closer to the skills I love to use: collecting, curating and organizing.

education.area: Computer Science and Human Computer Interaction
education.institution: Université Paul Sabatier / Edinburgh Napier University

work.summary: Contributing to Software Heritage projects related to software metadata. Software Heritage is a foundation, which mission is to preserve all software through a universal software archive.
work.name: Software Heritage

highlights: Spoke at several events (including university talks, and a radio interview) to promote the use of free software in public administrations.
Managed and trained a team of 6 interns during 6 months as part of the BlueHats Semester of Code programme.
work.summary: Advocated for free software in public administrations within the French Free Software Unit.
work.name: DINUM
work.position: Free Software Commissioner and Web Developer

highlights: Acculturation to French administration, and paper and digital preservation practices.
Developed an open source file transfer application prototype for and in collaboration with archivists.
work.summary: 1 year immersion into the Programme Vitam, a French inter-ministerial programme developing an open source digital preservation software.
work.name: Ministère de la Culture

work.summary: 1 year immersion into the Marketing Team of a French software company making an open source content management platform.
work.name: Nuxeo
work.position: Web Developer ("Volontariat International en Entreprise" programme)

highlights: Completed a 3 months internship for a small e-commerce company (x2i).
Completed a 3 months internship for the Computer Science laboratory of Toulouse (IRIT).
Completed a 6 months internship for Airbus Defense & Space.
work.name: Misc.

keywords: Playing the Flute and the Guitar
